data.title: Rhamnus cathartica
data.meta_description: Common Buckthorn is a robust and cold hardy shrub that attracts a wealth of wildlife. It takes well to trimming and works well as a hedge. It's considered invasive in parts of the US, but grown in...
data.text:
Context

native region: Europe, northwest Africa and western Asia

native habitat: scrub, hedges and woodland

family: Rhamnaceae

Needs, tolerances

Light: Semi-shade or full sun

soil pH: Acid, neutral -basic alkaline a

USDA Hardiness Zone: 3 - 7

Prefers a dry or moist calcareous soil

Known hazards

The fruit is purgative and is mildly poisonous. Other parts of the plant may also be poisonous.​

Overview

Deciduous shrub growing to 6m x 3m at a medium rate. ​

It is in flower in May - June, and the seeds ripen in October.

The species is dioecious (individual flowers are either male or female)vbut only one sex is to be found on any one plant so both male and female plants must be grown if seed is required)

The plant is not self fertile

Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils.

Suitable pH: acid, neutral and basic (alkaline) soils and can grow in very alkaline soils.

It can grow in semi-shade (light woodland) or full sun. It prefers dry or moist soil.
